bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The duties, powers and functions of the minister include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: encouraging development of the tourism industry in British Columbia;
reflecting tourism interests in land and resource use and management decisions;
encouraging the development of the motion picture industry in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: develop policies, plans and programs that reflect the duties, powers and functions set out in subsection (1),

encourage the enhancement of the standards of accommodation, facilities, tourist services and related amenities and support structures necessary to facilitate and support tourists in British Columbia,
enhance the professionalism and job creation potential of the tourism industry in British Columbia by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: developing occupational standards and certification processes, and
developing and sponsoring training programs, seminars and other activities through which information can be shared and expertise developed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: collect, evaluate and disseminate information regarding the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: trends in tourist activities, expectations and needs;
the availability and suitability of transportation and other facilities and services supporting tourism activities;
land and resources for tourism use,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide tourists with travel services and with information on the following:
promote British Columbia as a tourism destination, and
negotiate and enter into agreements or arrangements relating to tourism or any other matter referred to in this section,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: subject to the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, with the government of a province or the government of Canada or any agency of or other body created by any one or more of those governments, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsections (1) and (2), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sell or otherwise dispose of to any person, or authorize a person or organization to sell or otherwise dispose of to any person, magazines, informational material or other products or services related to the promotion of tourism,
sell products referred to in paragraph (a) to a person for resale or other disposition,
sell or otherwise dispose of advertising space in those products, and
establish the prices at which those products and services, and that advertising space, may be sold or otherwise disposed of.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may establish different prices for different classes of services or products, including advertising space, for different types of dispositions or for disposition to different classes of persons.
